intro: Centinodium, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has fleshy, succulent leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. Centinodium thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and drought conditions. Its unique botanical features make it an important species in desert ecosystems.
